text: Men would live exceedingly quiet if these two words, mine and thine, were taken away.
author: Anaxagoras

text: Grown men can learn from very little children for the hearts of little children are pure. Therefore, the Great Spirit may show to them many things which older people miss.
author: Black Elk

text: Two things control men's nature, instinct and experience.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Older men declare war. But it is the youth that must fight and die.
author: Herbert Hoover

text: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.
author: William Blake
